item.title: Today's Q&A for Jiayee (30 Sep 2020)
item.description: How do you get out of a rut? A “rut” is “a habit or pattern of behaviour that has become dull and unproductive but is hard to change”. (Oxford Languages). Start small. Materialise the plan for your adjustments (e.g. make a planning sheet). Maintain regularity and discipline on these small adjustments until you are comfortable. Always be conscious and bring yourself back whenever you find yourself losing discipline. Make further adjustments.
